oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SINKING OF SCOUR PROTECTIONS AT HORNS REV 1 OFFSHORE WIND FARM
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nielsen, Anders Wedel
Sumer, B. Mutlu
Petersen, Thor Ugelvig
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: scour protection
offshore wind farms
sinking of scour protections
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The present study is an attempt to explain the reason for the sinking of the scour protection observed at Horns Rev 1 Offshore Wind Farm. A new method for analyzing the survey data has been developed based on detailed descriptions in the literature of the processes causing sinking. The results of the analysis of the survey data have shown that the largest relative damage was observed at shallow water and for the largest scour protections. This is found - based on descriptions found in the literature - to be characteristic for sinking in wave dominated climate and as the current at Horns Rev is found to be too weak to mobilize the sediment underneath the scour protections, it is found likely that the waves had a major influence on the sinking of the scour protections at Horns Rev 1 Offshore Wind Farm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 34 (2014): Proceedings of 34th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Seoul, Korea, 2014; sediment.67
